Historical Documents
Foreign Relations of the United States: Diplomatic Papers, 1945, General: The United Nations, Volume I
Foreign Relations of the United States: Diplomatic Papers, 1945, General: The United Nations, Volume I
Editors:
Velma Hastings Cassidy Ralph R. Goodwin George H. Dengler
General Editor:
E. Ralph Perkins S. Everett Gleason Fredrick Aandahl
United States Government Printing Office
Washington
1967
Preface
Introductory note
List of papers
Guide to discussions of Dumbarton Oaks proposals and corresponding articles of the Charter of the United Nations, 1944–1945
The United Nations Conference on International Organization, San Francisco, California, April 25–June 26, 1945
Introductory note by the Editor
List of persons
Chapter I: January 1–March 8, 1945 (Documents 1-61) Chapter II: March 9–April 9, 1945 (Documents 62-137) Chapter III: April 10–April 24, 1945 (Documents 138-176) Chapter IV: April 25–May 7, 1945 (Documents 177-215) Chapter V: May 8–May 31, 1945 (Documents 216-262) Chapter VI: June 1–June 26, 1945 (Documents 263-320)
Efforts of the United States in the Preparatory Commission of the United Nations to effect an early establishment of the United Nations Organization; selection of the United States as the permanent location for the seat of the Organization (Documents 321-359) Participation by the United States in the establishment of the United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (Documents 360-374) Participation by the United States in the sessions of the International Labor Conference and Governing Body (Documents 375-387) Sponsorship by the Department of State of legislation resulting in the International Organizations Immunities Act of 1945 (Documents 388-393) Index
